channel.title: Did anyone know about these?
channel.description:
Archos 101 Internet Tablet. I'm not sure if it's out yet, but it look's pretty kickass.
http://www.archos.com/products/ta/archos_101it/index.html?country=us&lang=en
It's like an iPad but with the Android OS
[img]http://www.archos.com/img/archos_101it/A101it_google_search.png[/img]
[img]http://www.archos.com/img/archos_101it/A101it_design_1.png[/img]
Thing is huge, you can get smaller versions, all the way down to pocket sized handheld versions.
[img]http://www.archos.com/img/archos_32it/A32it_overview.png[/img]
I think I'm going to buy the Archos 32

item.title: Did anyone know about these?
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

Zenithink zt180, Haipad m701 are two decent models also don’t put your money on archos until they deliver. They promised andriod 2.1 before anyone else and 3 chinese (zenithink, EKEN, Haipad) companies beat them to it.

Read full topic

item.title: Did anyone know about these?
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

Miss Silabsoft:

Take a look at the chinese alternatives also. I’m holding out until someone gets android 2.2 on a pad as flash seems to be required on pretty much %80 precent of the websites i visit. Also look into the fact that the chinese pads have different firmwares you can flash.

The Archos 43 and up are coming out around October and they are supposed to run on Android 2.2 and have flash support.

As for the Chinese alternatives, I can’t find any besides the aPad. :S

Read full topic

Pretty sexy although you’d probably pay a pretty hefty price for them…
